comment.author: 13070533@N07
comment._content: It's definitely a trumpeter from the Household Cavalry, although whether Life Guards, Royal Horse Guards or Blues, I can't say. He is wearing State Dress (only worn on state occasions by permission of the monarch or at the request of the Lord Mayor of London, who traditionally paid for it) and the VR monogram on the gold-laced coat suggests that the photograph was taken before the death of Queen Victoria in 1901, or shortly thereafter.
